Erik Wilde (@dret): API Anti-Patterns: WD-40 for Your Digital Initiatives

(2) Summary

The success rate of digital initiatives in organizations is relatively low. Various studies report that around three quarters of initiatives do not yield the expected results. Many aspects that can lead to disappointing results, and one of these aspects is the question how APIs, which are one of the foundational building blocks of any digital initiative, are being managed. We look at the most important aspects of API management (strategy, program, platform, products) and illustrate with examples which problems jeopardize the success of API management, and ultimately of digital initiatives. These API anti-patterns will help you to check your organization's digital initiative for well-known issues.

(10) What is an Anti-Pattern?

  • Commonly used pattern that creates more bad outcomes than good ones
  • Better working alternatives exist and can be used instead


Technological Determinism

Outline (Technological Determinism)

  1. Introduction [2]
  2. API Initiative Success [4]

Technological Determinism Erik Wilde (@dret): API Anti-Patterns: WD-40 for Your Digital Initiatives

(12) Technology Implies Success

  • API platforms are necessary but not sufficient for scaling API adoption
  • API success needs high-quality/high-value API products
  • Does it help a team to publish an API and do they know how to use APIs?


Technological Determinism Erik Wilde (@dret): API Anti-Patterns: WD-40 for Your Digital Initiatives

(13) Explain and Convince and Celebrate

  • Explain what APIs are and how they are the foundation of anything digital
  • Convince that teams collaborating via APIs drives digital transformation
  • Celebrate growth and success stories so that API value becomes visible


Quantity over Quality

Outline (Quantity over Quality)

  1. Introduction [2]

Quantity over Quality Erik Wilde (@dret): API Anti-Patterns: WD-40 for Your Digital Initiatives

(15) Many APIs > Fewer APIs

  • Simplistic KPIs that focus on producing more APIs
  • Ignoring that API consumption is the main driver of API value
  • Treating APIs as just another thing teams have to do


Quantity over Quality Erik Wilde (@dret): API Anti-Patterns: WD-40 for Your Digital Initiatives

(16) What's an API's Value?

  • Successful APIs are APIs that are used and reused
  • The goal is to drive more value through APIs
  • Focus on unlocking value based on usage potential vs. actual usage


Production over Consumption

Outline (Production over Consumption)

  1. Introduction [2]
  2. API Initiative Success [4]
  3. Technological Determinism [2]

Production over Consumption Erik Wilde (@dret): API Anti-Patterns: WD-40 for Your Digital Initiatives

(18) Build it and they will come?

  • APIs are necessary but not sufficient for API success
  • API platforms are necessary but not sufficient for API success
  • API programs are necessary but not sufficient for API success


Production over Consumption Erik Wilde (@dret): API Anti-Patterns: WD-40 for Your Digital Initiatives

(19) API Value = Potential × Consumption

  • Designed as digital building blocks focusing on value
  • Published easily thereby evolving to the platform
  • Discovered in a catalog of all digital building blocks
  • Subscribed so that the building block can be used
  • Used to build new products
  • Improved to make the digital building block more valuable


Beware the Uni-API

Outline (Beware the Uni-API)

  1. Introduction [2]
  2. API Initiative Success [4]

Beware the Uni-API Erik Wilde (@dret): API Anti-Patterns: WD-40 for Your Digital Initiatives

(21) We've been doing that for 30 years …

  • Technically speaking APIs have been around since computers were invented
  • Existing systems and architectures certainly have many APIs in them
  • IT architecture often focuses on technical structure and less on business changeability


Beware the Uni-API Erik Wilde (@dret): API Anti-Patterns: WD-40 for Your Digital Initiatives

(22) … let's look at what's different then!

  • The challenge is creating APIs that align with business goals and organizational structure
  • The goal is for teams to be able to build quickly without integration projects
  • Present the API of the week for everybody to use in their own products


The Return of the EIM

Outline (The Return of the EIM)

  1. Introduction [2]
  2. API Initiative Success [4]
  3. Technological Determinism [2]
  4. Quantity over Quality [2]
  5. Production over Consumption [2]

  8. Conclusions [2]
The Return of the EIM Erik Wilde (@dret): API Anti-Patterns: WD-40 for Your Digital Initiatives

(24) Model-Driven APIs

  • All world models need to be aligned for better API compatibility
  • Deriving all APIs from the model allows for better automation at the API level
  • Defining/delivering APIs becomes secondary to aligning them with the organization's model


The Return of the EIM Erik Wilde (@dret): API Anti-Patterns: WD-40 for Your Digital Initiatives

(25) Embrace Diversity

  • We all talk about the same things but we may talk about them differently
  • Make it easy to discover and reuse building blocks for APIs
  • The goal is not perfect understanding but more effective collaboration

Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): API Anti-Patterns: WD-40 for Your Digital Initiatives

(27) Unstick Your API Initiative!

  • Find out what holds you back most
  • Switch to patterns and practices that work
  • Continuously watch out for new friction points


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): API Anti-Patterns: WD-40 for Your Digital Initiatives
